Posts.Title: pleomorphic calcifications in axilla lymph node newlife1 acid

Posts.Content: Feb 5, 2013 11:57AM acid wrote: EmD, Sorry for your lack of answers.  I feel a similar frustration.  I can feel a lump on the side that wasn't adressed by US- and they said mammo is best.  But I read a study that came out in OCT 2012 that said for women under 39 US is best diagnostic tool.  SO I called breast center back and said I would really like another US.  They said only doc can order another one, so I made an appt with doc for this TH and will push for another US or MRI. The amazing women here encouraged me to keep on until I felt satisfied with the answers (or lack thereof!).  I hope you are able to do the same. Praying we both find our lumps and pain have no malignancy! Thinking of you!
Posts.Title: Had my ultrasound today... EmD ChefHolli

Posts.Content: Feb 6, 2013 12:38PM acid wrote: Sending out prayers and positive vibes and lots of virtual (((HUGS)))
Posts.Title: at the hospital for my biopsy Ammonova mrenee68

Posts.Content: acid wrote: I had a second meeting with BS yesterday.  Reiterated my worry about the pain in my breast and the "lump' I felt.  She was very kind, did another full manual BE and felt nothing she thought was concerning.  She thought the 'lump' was normal breast tissue ridge.  Ordered another review of last weeks mammo and another US- and one for the other breast for good measure.  Yesterday's radiologist was very, very kind.  The BS said they won't US the entire breast- just where it hurts.  However, the radiologist did the whole breast to be extra thorough.  She took a long time.  (and this was after the tech did it too) She said she saw several very small, fluid filled, normal looking cysts.  No lumps, masses or changes that caused her any concern.  I do have some fibrous tissue, scarring from reduction but the tissue had nothing that worried her and she really looked.  She also did other breast, too.  After she was done, she reached over and grabbed my hand (reminded me of how my grandmother used to) and said, "I am very reassured by your ultrasound.  I don't want you to worry.  Come back in one year.  Or if you need more reassurance".  She was so kind!   Although I still have the discomfort, I am very relieved at the thoroughness of the docs, their compassion and the fact they said to comeback anytime if I am still concerned.  The lump I felt was a ridge of  tissue, the Radiologist  showed me on the US.   I am going to take this as a sign to breathe and trust.  Of course, if something comes up or I continue to feel very strongly something is wrong, I will follow up.  However, I know (as do all of you) that anxiety was the biggest pain recently. Thank you all for your wonderful wisdom and support.  I will be following and saying prayers for you all! All the best- A Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Second (and third) US were clear... acid marie5890
